developmental_risk_block.text: Developmental risk is flagged due to limited adolescent data and uncertain long-term effects. Endocrine, growth, neurodevelopmental, and metabolic setpoints may be sensitive to perturbation. This section is descriptive only; uncertainty is explicitly acknowledged.

changelog.summary: Initial canonical entry for Thymosin Beta-4 (full length)
changelog.detail: Generated from queue ingestion (Phase 6). Requires human-authored, evidence-bounded content.

practical.bottom_line: Thymosin beta-4 full-length is the canonical TB4 peptide discussed in wound and tissue repair research. In consumer markets, it is frequently confused with fragments and look-alike products, which creates identity and quality risk. The practical takeaway is that sourcing, labeling accuracy, and medical appropriateness drive most of the real-world downside.
benefits: Soft-tissue recovery interest after overuse or injury
Skin and wound recovery interest in research contexts
Return-to-training support interest during rehabilitation periods
Preference for full-length identity clarity in product discussions
side_effects_serious: Allergic reaction with hives, facial swelling, or trouble breathing
Chest pain, fainting, or severe shortness of breath
Severe swelling, rapidly spreading redness, or drainage at an injection site
who_should_be_cautious: Active cancer or recent cancer treatment
